org.sbrubbles.conditio

Class Scope

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sbrubbles.conditio.Scope
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public final class Scope
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable
    The resource responsible for managing the signalling machinery and the available handlers and restarts.

    The main operation is signal(Condition, Restart...), which is called when lower-level code doesn't know how to handle a certain situation. Basically, signal looks for something that can handle the given condition. This handler may return a result itself, or look for a recovery strategy (also known as a restart), and use it to provide a result.

    Restarts only make sense for specific situations, and therefore are set only when the condition is signalled, or when code calling a signalling method wraps that call with call(Supplier, Restart...).

    This class creates and manages a stack of nested Scopes, and provides ways to search for handlers and restarts throughout this stack. This nesting is handled with create() and particularly close(), which will unnest the scope as execution leaves it. As a consequence, createing a scope without closeing it properly will break the nesting. Use it only in a try-with-resources, and you'll be fine :)

    In practice, usage should look something like this: 

       try(Scope scope = Scope.create()) {
     // establishing a new handler, which delegates the work to a RetryWith-compatible restart
     scope.handle(MalformedEntry.class, (c, s) -> s.restart(new RetryWith("FAIL: " + c.getText())));

     // ...somewhere deeper in the call stack...
     try(Scope scope = Scope.create()) {
       // signals a condition, sets a restart, and waits for the result
       Entry entry = (Entry) scope.signal(new MalformedEntry("NOOOOOOOO"),
                                Restart.on(RetryWith.class, r -> func(r.getValue())));

       // carry on...
     }
   }
    See Also:
    Condition, Handler, Restart

    • Method Detail

      • handle

        public <C extends Condition,S extends C> Scope handle(Class<S> conditionType,
                                                      BiFunction<C,Scope,?> body)
        Establishes a new handler in this scope. It is responsible for handling conditions, returning a result for signal. The handler may compute this result by itself, or it may delegate to a restart.
        Parameters:
        conditionType - the type of conditions handled.
        body - the handler code, which takes as arguments a condition and the scope where signal() was called, and returns a result.
        Returns:
        this instance, for method chaining.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if one or both parameters are null.
        See Also:
        signal(Condition, Restart...), restart(Restart.Option), Handler

      • call

        public <T> T call(Supplier<T> body,
                  Restart... restarts)
        Establishes some restarts, available to all code in or called by body. It's useful for adding recovery strategies to calls that may signal conditions.

        Usage: 

         final Restart SKIP_ENTRY = Restart.on(SkipEntry.class, r -> SKIP_ENTRY_MARKER);

 for (String line : lines) {
   // parseLogEntry may signal a condition. This code isn't handling it,
   // but it provides SKIP_ENTRY as one more possible restart
   Entry entry = scope.call(() -> parseLogEntry(line), SKIP_ENTRY);

   if (!SKIP_ENTRY_MARKER.equals(entry)) {
     entries.add(entry);
   }
 }
        Parameters:
        body - some code.
        restarts - some restarts, which will be made available to all code in or called by body.
        Returns:
        the result of calling body.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if at least one parameter is null.
        See Also:
        Restart.on(Class, Function)

      • signal

        public Object signal(Condition condition,
                     Restart... restarts)
              throws HandlerNotFoundException
        Signals a situation which the currently running code doesn't know how to handle. This method will search for a compatible handler and run it, returning the result.
        Parameters:
        condition - a condition, representing a situation which higher-level code will decide how to handle.
        restarts - some restarts, which will be available to the eventual handler.
        Returns:
        the end result, as provided by the selected handler.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if no condition or a null restart array was given.
        HandlerNotFoundException - if no available handler was able to handle this condition.
        See Also:
        handle(Class, BiFunction), getAllHandlers(), Restart, Restart.on(Class, Function)

      • restart

        public Object restart(Restart.Option restartOption)
               throws RestartNotFoundException
        Invokes a previously set recovery strategy. This method will search for a compatible restart and run it, returning the result.
        Parameters:
        restartOption - identifies which restart to run, and holds any data required for that restart's operation.
        Returns:
        the result of the selected restart's execution.
        Throws:
        RestartNotFoundException - if no restart compatible with restartOption could be found.
        See Also:
        getAllRestarts()

      • getAllHandlers

        public Iterable<Handler> getAllHandlers()
        An object to iterate over all active handlers in the call stack, starting from this instance to the root scope.
        Returns:
        an iterable to get all active handlers in the call stack.

      • getAllRestarts

        public Iterable<Restart> getAllRestarts()
        An object to iterate over all active restarts in the call stack, starting from this instance to the root scope.
        Returns:
        an iterable to get all active restarts in the call stack.

      • getHandlers

        public List<Handler> getHandlers()
        The active handlers in this scope.
        Returns:
        the active handlers in this scope, in an unmodifiable list.

      • getRestarts

        public List<Restart> getRestarts()
        The active restarts in this scope.
        Returns:
        the active restarts in this scope, in an unmodifiable list.

      • create

        public static Scope create()
        Creates and returns a new instance, nested in the (now former) current scope.
        Returns:
        a new instance.

      • getParent

        public Scope getParent()
        The Scope instance wrapping this one. May be null if this is the topmost Scope.
        Returns:
        the Scope instance wrapping this one, or null if this is a root scope.

      • isRoot

        public boolean isRoot()
        If this is the topmost scope in its execution.
        Returns:
        true if this is the topmost scope.

      • close

        public void close()
        Updates the current scope when execution leaves the try block.
